title: Get Started
text: install package Github: use package installed: Make sure packages installed well:

title: Get Started
text: package simulates estimates class panel regression models following form: \[ y_{} = x_{}'\beta + w_{}'\gamma + \epsilon_{} + \nu_{}, \] data described follows: \(\) indexes cross-sectional unit; \(t\) indexes time period; \(y_{}\) outcome interest; \(x_{}\) vector endogenous regressors; , \(w_{}\) vector exogenous regressors goal estimate \(\beta\), \(\gamma\) treated nuisance parameter. three unobservable processes: \(\epsilon_{}\) error term upon \(x_{}\) depends. independent \(w_{}\); \(\nu_{}\) serially-independent shock independent \(x_{}, x_{-1},...\) \(w_{}, w_{-1},...\); , \(\eta_{}\) another serially-independent shock independent \(x_{-1},x_{-2},...\) \(w_{}, w_{-1},...\) “model” refers assumed time-series process governing \(\epsilon_{}\): Fixed Effects (“FE”): \(\epsilon_{} = \alpha_i\). Serially Independent (“iid”): \(\epsilon_{} = \eta_{}\), \(\eta_{}\) exogenous. Moving Average Order 1 (“MA1”): \(\epsilon_{} = \eta_{} + \theta \eta_{-1}\), \(\eta_{}\) exogenous. First Order Autoregressive (“AR1”): \(\epsilon_{} = \rho \epsilon_{-1} + \eta_{}\), \(\eta_{}\) exogenous. estimators assume number time periods small sample size large (“small-T big-N” asymptotics).

title: Get Started
text: package contains two functions: PanelRegSim: Simulate panel data according model specification. PanelReg: Estimate \(\beta\) given assumed model. order use PanelReg, must first define variable names. required variable names : id_name: name variable indexes cross-sectional unit. time_name: name variable indexes time period. outcome_name: name outcome variable. endogenous_names: vector names endogenous regressors. covariate_names: vector names exogenous regressors. optional variable name. following code block defines variable names examples :
code: varnames = list(   id_name = "unit_id",   time_name = "time_id",   outcome_name = "outcome",   endogenous_names = c("endog_var1", "endog_var2"),   covariate_names = NULL )

title: Get Started
text:
error term given \(\epsilon_{} = \alpha_i\). data can simulated follows: Ignoring endogeneity, biased estimates follows: first-difference model , \[ y_{} - y_{-1} = (x_{} - x_{-1})' eta + (w_{} - w_{-1})'\gamma + (
u_{} - 
u_{-1}), \] Since unobservable differenced equation, \(
u_{} - 
u_{-1}\), independent regressors, \( eta\) can estimated without instrument. implementation follows:
code: simulated_data = PanelRegSim(panel_model = "FE", seed = 123, sample_size = 10000,                               min_year = 2003, max_year = 2006, true_beta = c(0.5, -0.2))  head(simulated_data) #>    unit_id time_id  outcome endog_var1 endog_var2 #>      <int>   <int>    <num>      <num>      <num> #> 1:       1    2003 1.797459   3.215460  5.1756350 #> 2:       1    2004 5.832963   4.512461  2.9302959 #> 3:       1    2005 2.252843   4.510639  4.7811913 #> 4:       1    2006 2.254339   3.823210  6.2593176 #> 5:       2    2003 1.309357   2.266071  0.8602314 #> 6:       2    2004 1.489940   3.104535  2.4039799 reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "exogenous", varnames = varnames) head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.626710 0.004945 126.73009      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.142894 0.004849 -29.46713      0 reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "FE", varnames = varnames) head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.491472 0.008197  59.95752      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.205604 0.006836 -30.07640      0

title: Get Started
text: error term given \(\epsilon_{} = \eta_{}\). model can simulated follows: Ignoring endogeneity, biased estimates follows: contemporaneous \(x_{}\) depends \(\eta_{}\), lag \(x_{-1}\) independent \(\eta_{}\). Since \(x_{-1}\) valid instrument, can estimate \(\beta\) regressing \(y_{}\) \(x_{}\), instrumented \(x_{-1}\), controlling \(w_{}\). implementation follows:
code: simulated_data = PanelRegSim(panel_model = "iid", seed = 123, sample_size = 10000,                               min_year = 2003, max_year = 2006, true_beta = c(0.5, -0.2))  head(simulated_data) #>    unit_id time_id  outcome endog_var1  endog_var2 #>      <int>   <int>    <num>      <num>       <num> #> 1:       1    2003 1.929295   2.838065  1.99528333 #> 2:       1    2004 5.128384   3.030035  0.07371323 #> 3:       1    2005 1.299690   2.435264 -1.50636137 #> 4:       1    2006 2.982400   3.424700 -0.25137488 #> 5:       2    2003 3.199773   4.379467  2.34207665 #> 6:       2    2004 3.425321   4.196123  2.10616311 reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "exogenous", varnames = varnames) head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.622355 0.004918 126.54661      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.142607 0.004824 -29.56163      0 reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "iid", varnames = varnames)  head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.490619 0.007004  70.05026      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.204615 0.007157 -28.59118      0

title: Get Started
text: error term given \(\epsilon_{} = \eta_{} + \theta \eta_{-1}\). data can simulated follows: Ignoring endogeneity, biased estimates follows: Estimating model “iid” model, biased estimates follows: Similarly “iid” case, can use lagged values \(x\) valid instruments contemporaneous \(x\). Since \(\epsilon\) serially dependent adjacent periods (\(\epsilon_{}\) correlated \(\epsilon_{-1}\) uncorrelated \(\epsilon_{-2}\)), non-adjacent lags \(x\) valid instruments. implementation thus uses \(x_{-2}\) instrument. implementation follows:
code: simulated_data = PanelRegSim(panel_model = "MA1", seed = 123, sample_size = 10000,                               min_year = 2003, max_year = 2006, true_beta = c(0.5, -0.2))  head(simulated_data) #> Key: <unit_id, time_id> #>    unit_id time_id  outcome endog_var1 endog_var2 #>      <int>   <int>    <num>      <num>      <num> #> 1:       1    2003 1.929295   2.838065  1.9952833 #> 2:       1    2004 5.408838   3.146891  0.1321411 #> 3:       1    2005 1.448656   2.497334 -1.4753267 #> 4:       1    2006 2.748390   3.327196 -0.3001270 #> 5:       2    2003 3.199773   4.379467  2.3420766 #> 6:       2    2004 3.849078   4.372688  2.1944457 reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "exogenous", varnames = varnames) head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.652539 0.005140 126.96545      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.130209 0.005077 -25.64695      0 reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "iid", varnames = varnames) head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.587912 0.006969  84.36152      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.158252 0.007341 -21.55651      0 reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "MA1", varnames = varnames)  head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.495611 0.010123  48.95919      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.200817 0.010273 -19.54823      0

title: Get Started
text: error term given \(\epsilon_{} = \rho\epsilon_{-1} + \eta_{}\). data can simulated follows: Ignoring endogeneity, biased estimates follows: Estimating model “iid” model, biased estimates follows: Estimating model “MA1” model, biased estimates follows: package provides two strategies estimating AR(1) model: Panel IV GMM. Panel IV: error structure implies , \[ y_{} = \rho y_{-1} + x_{}'\beta +  x_{-1}'(-\beta\rho) +  x_{}'\gamma + x_{-1}'(-\gamma\rho) + \eta_{}\] Since \(x_{}\) depends unobservable \(\eta_{}\), lagged values \(x\) independent contemporaneous \(\eta\), follows \(\beta\) can estimated regression \(y_{}\) \(x_{}\), instrument \(x_{-2}\), controlling \((y_{-1}, x_{-1}, w_{-1})\). Another available instrument \(y_{-2}\), option use lagged outcome IV well. GMM: error structure implies , guess \((\beta,\gamma,\rho)\), can construct implied \(\eta\): \[\hat\eta(\beta,\gamma,\rho) \equiv (y_{} - \rho y_{-1}) - (x_{} - \rho x_{-1})'\beta - (w_{} - \rho w_{-1})'\gamma\] GMM approach uses , true values parameters, following vector moments hold: \[\mathbb{E}[(x_{-1},x_{-2},w_{}) \hat\eta(\beta,\gamma,\rho) ] = \vec{0}\] Similar moments hold respect lagged values outcome, \(y_{-1}\) \(y_{-2}\) implementation follows: Implementations: Estimating AR(1) model first requires defining AR1_options, list options estimation. options : AR1_method: estimation method use. options “PanelIV” “GMM”. required. AR1_IV_outcome: logical indicating whether lagged outcome used instrument. required. AR1_IV_lags: number lags outcome use instruments. required AR1_method = “GMM”. However, always 2 AR1_method = “PanelIV”. PanelIV implementation including lagged outcomes IVs: GMM implementation, using 2 lags including lagged outcomes IVs: Note estimate AR(1) persistence parameter, \(\rho\), returned method “AR1”.
code: simulated_data = PanelRegSim(panel_model = "AR1", seed = 123, sample_size = 100000, noise_sd=0,                               min_year = 2003, max_year = 2008, true_beta = c(0.5, -0.2))  head(simulated_data) #> Key: <unit_id> #>    unit_id time_id     outcome endog_var1 endog_var2 #>      <int>   <int>       <num>      <num>      <num> #> 1:       1    2003  0.22310355  2.1513782   5.519912 #> 2:       1    2004  0.04373321 -0.2229055   3.651452 #> 3:       1    2005 -0.11135351 -0.8057516   4.704462 #> 4:       1    2006  0.05702288 -0.7722665   2.997190 #> 5:       1    2007  0.87868944 -1.5009146   2.464164 #> 6:       1    2008  0.45846618 -0.8560450   4.653757 reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "exogenous", varnames = varnames) head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.630611 0.000776  812.4119      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.136847 0.000777 -176.2153      0 reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "iid", varnames = varnames) head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.592757 0.000967  612.7980      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.150982 0.001018 -148.3766      0 reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "MA1", varnames = varnames) head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.570951 0.001200  475.6527      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.160632 0.001254 -128.1010      0 AR1_options = list(   AR1_method = "PanelIV",   AR1_IV_outcome = TRUE )  reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "AR1", varnames = varnames,  AR1_options = AR1_options)  head(reg) #>           Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>             <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1:      endog_var1  0.504755 0.009623  52.45215      0 #> 2:      endog_var2 -0.191960 0.005660 -33.91443      0 #> 3: AR1_persistence  0.499293 0.002572 194.13448      0 AR1_options = list(   AR1_method = "GMM",   AR1_IV_outcome = TRUE,   AR1_IV_lags = 2 )  reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "AR1", varnames = varnames,  AR1_options = AR1_options)  head(reg) #>           Variable  Estimate #>             <char>     <num> #> 1:      endog_var1  0.500346 #> 2:      endog_var2 -0.194480 #> 3: AR1_persistence  0.497813

title: Get Started
text: Consider “AR1” model. can add covariates simulated model setting true_gamma parameter: control covariates, estimation becomes biased: control covariates, add names varnames list:
code: simulated_data = PanelRegSim(panel_model = "AR1", seed = 123, sample_size = 20000,                               noise_sd = 0, min_year = 2003, max_year = 2009,                               true_beta = c(0.5, -0.2), true_gamma = c(1, -0.5))  head(simulated_data) #> Key: <unit_id> #>    unit_id time_id    outcome endog_var1 endog_var2  co_var1 #>      <int>   <int>      <num>      <num>      <num>    <num> #> 1:       1    2003 -1.2243353   3.603220   3.044912 5.354628 #> 2:       1    2004 -0.6788179   3.794424   1.597571 4.113133 #> 3:       1    2005  1.2460489   4.266911   2.158675 2.650032 #> 4:       1    2006 -0.1901712   6.271369   4.334303 6.002911 #> 5:       1    2007  2.5888070   7.665698   5.465854 3.410830 #> 6:       1    2008  1.6945940   6.363167   4.276865 4.330093 AR1_options = list(   AR1_method = "PanelIV",   AR1_IV_outcome = TRUE )  reg = PanelReg(panel_data = copy(simulated_data), panel_model = "AR1", varnames = varnames, AR1_options = AR1_options)  head(reg) #>           Variable  Estimate       SE     tvalue pvalue #>             <char>     <num>    <num>      <num>  <num> #> 1:      endog_var1  0.178258 0.023163   7.695812      0 #> 2:      endog_var2 -0.210192 0.013292 -15.813682      0 #> 3: AR1_persistence  0.385460 0.005390  71.519025      0 varnames$covariate_names = c("co_var1")  reg = PanelReg(panel_data = copy(simulated_data), panel_model = "AR1", varnames = varnames, AR1_options = AR1_options)  head(reg) #>           Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>             <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1:      endog_var1  0.460510 0.022811  20.18812      0 #> 2:      endog_var2 -0.184835 0.010847 -17.03945      0 #> 3: AR1_persistence  0.502494 0.005254  95.64507      0

title: Authors and Citation
text: Bradley Setzler. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Setzler B (2024). PanelReg: Estimate Panel Regression Models. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://setzler.github.io/PanelReg/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {PanelReg: Estimate Panel Regression Models},   author = {Bradley Setzler},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://setzler.github.io/PanelReg/}, }

title: Estimate Panel Regression Models
text: package simulates estimates class panel regression models form, yit = xit′β + wit′γ + ϵit + νit. parameter interest β, xit vector endogenous regressors, wit vector exogenous covariates, ϵit endogenous unobservable, νit exogenous unobservable (.e. measurement error). purpose package provide convenient estimator β given common time-series process assumptions ϵit, : Fixed Effects (“FE”): ϵit = αi. Serially Independent (“iid”): ϵit = ηit, ηit exogenous. Moving Average Order 1 (“MA1”): ϵit = ηit + θηit − 1, ηit exogenous. First Order Autoregressive (“AR1”): ϵit = ρϵit − 1 + ηit, ηit exogenous. 2 functions package: PanelReg(): function estimates panel regression. Documentation available running ?PanelReg R. PanelRegSim(): function simulates data panel regression model. Documentation available running ?PanelRegSim R.

title: Estimate Panel Regression Models
text: estimation, set variable list names variables: estimate panel regression, syntax follows: argument panel_model must one "exogenous", "FE", "iid", "MA1", "AR1". complete examples details estimators, see Get Started page.
code: varnames = list(   id_name = "id",   time_name = "year",   outcome_name = "Y",   endogenous_names = c("X1", "X2"),   covariate_names = c("W1") ) reg = PanelReg(panel_data, panel_model = "MA1", varnames)

title: Estimate Panel Regression Models
text: install package Github: use package installed: Make sure packages installed well:

what: Estimate a panel regression model — PanelReg
title: Estimate a panel regression model — PanelReg
text: function estimates panel regression model.

title: Estimate a panel regression model — PanelReg
code: PanelReg(   panel_data,   panel_model = "iid",   varnames,   AR1_options = list(AR1_method = "PanelIV", AR1_IV_outcome = TRUE) )

title: Estimate a panel regression model — PanelReg
text: panel_data (data.table) data.table containing panel data. panel_model (character) panel model estimate. Must one "exogenous", "iid", "FE", "MA1", "AR1". varnames (list) list containing names variables panel_data. must contain following elements: id_name, time_name, outcome_name, endogenous_names. Optionally, also contains covariate_names. id_name time_name names unit time variables, respectively. outcome_name name outcome variable. endogenous_names character vector names endogenous variables. covariate_names character vector names exogenous variables. covariate_names NULL, model estimated without exogenous variables. AR1_options (list) panel_model != "AR1", list ignored. panel_model = "AR1", list must non-empty. contains options estimating AR(1) model. must contain following elements: AR1_method, AR1_IV_lags, AR1_IV_outcome, AR1_persistence. AR1_method method use estimate AR(1) model, must one "PanelIV" "GMM". AR1_IV_lags number lags use IV regression, must 1 2, used AR1_method = "GMM". AR1_IV_outcome specifies whether include lagged outcome variable instrument. particular lags outcome used inferred AR1_IV_lags. AR1_persistence value force AR(1) persistence parameter equal; NULL, AR(1) persistence parameter estimated. default AR1_options = list(AR1_method = "PanelIV", AR1_IV_outcome = TRUE).

title: Estimate a panel regression model — PanelReg
text: (data.table) estimates panel regression model.

title: Simulate a panel dataset. — PanelRegSim
text: function simulates panel dataset given number units time periods. user can specify distribution error term, number units, number time periods, parameters model. function returns panel dataset form data.table.

title: Simulate a panel dataset. — PanelRegSim
code: PanelRegSim(   seed = 1234,   sample_size = 100,   min_year = 2000,   max_year = 2010,   noise_sd = 1,   panel_model = "iid",   true_beta = 0.5,   endog_weight = 0.5,   MA1_persistence = 0.5,   AR1_persistence = 0.5,   true_gamma = c(1),   return_unobservables = FALSE )

title: Simulate a panel dataset. — PanelRegSim
text: seed (integer) seed random number generator. sample_size (integer) number units panel dataset. min_year (integer) first year panel dataset. max_year (integer) last year panel dataset. noise_sd (numeric) standard deviation measurement error. panel_model (character) panel model use. Options "iid", "FE", "AR1", "MA1". true_beta (numeric) true value parameter interest. endog_weight (numeric) weight endogenous variable panel model. Must 0 1. MA1_persistence (numeric) persistence parameter MA(1) process, .e., eps_it = shock_it + MA1_persistence * shock_it-1. AR1_persistence (numeric) persistence parameter AR(1) process, .e., eps_it = AR1_persistence * eps_it-1 + shock_it. true_gamma (numeric) true value parameter exogenous variables. first entry corresponds intercept. default, true_gamma = c(1). return_unobservables (logical) TRUE, function returns full panel dataset, including unobservable variables. FALSE, function returns observable variables.

title: Simulate a panel dataset. — PanelRegSim
text: (data.table) panel dataset.
